author: MovGP0
body:
# Steps to reproduce

- Use a multi layered keyboard layout like [Neo2](https://github.com/neo-layout/neo-layout/tree/master/windows)
- Install PowerShell 7.0.0-preview1
- Open PowerShell and enter a special character (ie. `-` or `$`). You need to hold the caps lock key to switch the input layer. 

# Expected behavior

Only the special character is entered on the console. Ie. 

```none
Get-ChildItem
$PsVersionTable
```

# Actual behavior

The special character is prefixed with an `@` sign: 

```none
Get@-ChildItem
@$PsVersionTable
```

In fact, every press of the caps lock key (Key Code 20) enters an `@` sign. 

# Environment data

```none
Name                           Value
----                           -----
PSVersion                      7.0.0-preview.1
PSEdition                      Core
GitCommitId                    7.0.0-preview.1
OS                             Microsoft Windows 10.0.18362
Platform                       Win32NT
PSCompatibleVersions           {1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0…}
PSRemotingProtocolVersion      2.3
SerializationVersion           1.1.0.1
WSManStackVersion              3.0
```

comments.author: MovGP0
comments.body: Note that PowerShell Core 6.x and PowerShell 5.x are not effected by this bug.
